de.gnwi.spicesviewer

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gnwi.spicesviewer.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Spices Viewer application's controller. By instantiating this class (see Main) the application is started. It holds a Spices object, a GraphStream Graph, an instance of the SpicesToGraphStream and all other classes defined in this package.
    Author:
    Jonas Schaub

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller(java.lang.String anAppDir, java.lang.String aTempDir)
      Constructor: It initialises the Controller's fields, adds various listeners to its Swing components, loads the UserPreferences from a '.ser' file and starts the application by setting the JFrame MainFrame visible.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void showStatusMessage(java.lang.String aMessage, java.awt.Color aColor)
      Starts a new ShowStatusMessageWorker with the given parameters to display a message in the MainFrame's status bar for a certain time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(java.lang.String anAppDir,
                  java.lang.String aTempDir)
        Constructor: It initialises the Controller's fields, adds various listeners to its Swing components, loads the UserPreferences from a '.ser' file and starts the application by setting the JFrame MainFrame visible.
        Parameters:
        anAppDir - the directory where the application should save its data (the user preferences file)
        aTempDir - the default temp file path of the JVM
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters is 'null' is no directory or does not exists

    • Method Detail

      • showStatusMessage

        public void showStatusMessage(java.lang.String aMessage,
                              java.awt.Color aColor)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts a new ShowStatusMessageWorker with the given parameters to display a message in the MainFrame's status bar for a certain time. If there is a message currently on display it will be overridden by canceling the running ShowStatusMessageWorker. This method is public because ImageExportGraphAttributeWorker and ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker need to call it upon completion of their tasks.
        Parameters:
        aMessage - the message to display
        aColor - the color in which to paint the message's text
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a parameter is 'null'
